newsitem.title: IRAQ: Russian MP, businessmen meet Iraqi officials.
newsitem.headline: Russian MP, businessmen meet Iraqi officials.

text.p: A team of Russian politicians and businessmen is in Iraq seeking better relations and business links under Iraq's oil-for-food deal with the United Nations, the official Iraqi News Agency (INA) reported on Wednesday.

It said the Russians led by Ramazan Abdulatipov, a senior member of Russia's lower house of parliament from the Moslem region of Dagestan, met Deputy Prime Minister Tareq Aziz, Foreign Minister Mohammed Saeed al-Sahaf and Speaker of Iraq's National Assembly Saadoun Hammadi.
"Aziz stressed Iraq's sincere desire to continue and deepen relations with Russia," INA said.
It said Abdulatipov called for the immediate lifting of U.N. sanctions imposed on Iraq for its 1990 invasion of Kuwait.
Aziz was in Moscow earlier this month to seek Russia's help in having the curbs removed.
Last month the Iraqi National Assembly ratified an oil contract with Russia under which Moscow is expected to develop seven to eight billion barrels of reserves in Iraq's southern Qurna oilfield.
Oil investment violates the U.N. sanctions. Russian officials said the contract would not start before the end of the curbs.

Moscow is also seeking to sell to Baghdad foodstuffs in return for buying oil under the oil-for-food deal with the United Nations which went into effect in December. The deal allows Iraq to sell $2 billion of oil over six months to buy urgently needed items.
